discourse_list.title: Has an adopted EIP (+hard fork) ever broken transaction structure backwards compatibility?

content.content: If I signed (but did not submit) a transaction on July 30, 2015, would it still be valid today (assuming I didn’t advance the nonce)? If not, which changes broke this backwards compatibility?
content.GPT-summary: The post is asking a technical question about the backwards compatibility of a specific Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) and hard fork. The author is asking if a transaction signed in 2015 would still be valid today and which changes may have broken backwards compatibility.
